text:
I installed Tomcat 5.5.9, and it would never startup inspite of several
restarts/shutdowns or even a reboot of the machine. Finally, after a deep google
search and long reads through forums, someone reported that there might be a
problem if there was a white-space in the installation directory. I had chosen
the default place during the installation, which was the "C:\Program
Files\Apache Software Foundation\Tomcat 5.5.9" folder. 

After a lot of frustration, I uninstalled the installation, and did a fresh
start at E:\Soft\Apache\Tomcat5.5.9, I didnt want to take any chances with any
white-space, and it worked beautifully.

Please treat this matter very seriously, as the default installation itself
seems to give me a problem.

Dutt.

Win 2000,
Tomcat 5.5.9
creator: duttbobba@gmail.com
remm@apache.org
text: This works for me. Please give (a lot) more details, or post to tomcat-user.

> This works for me. Please give (a lot) more details, or post to tomcat-user.

     I thought I was clear earlier. I will try to be clearer this time. I
installed Tomcat 5.5.9 on my Win2k machine, going through the installation steps
with the default configurations, and finishing it to start the service by
default. The default installation directory is .....\Tomcat 5.5.9, with a
white-space in between. The server did not come up successfully, but I do not
have the statements from err.log. After a lot of googling, a forum mentioned
that this was a known bug in Tomcat, and recommended me to install in another
directory without whitespaces. I did, and e/thing works sweet.

     I have to mention here that, I do not know that the whitespace is causing
the problem, but that is the only variable that changed in the 2 installations,
and the 2nd time it worked.

Dutt.
creator: duttbobba@gmail.com

text:
Works for me, out of the box.  I tried c:\documents and settings\me\tomcat, and
c:\tomcat 5.5.9 blah, no problem.
